javadoc:
A state object to provide a table cell renderer with data beyond the standard Java {@link javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer} interface.

Additional data about the context of a rendering operation -- like the columns' Settings or the row-object -- are easily passed to the renderer without refactor of each client.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create a data object for a specific column in a table.

params.name: columnSettings
params.comment: Settings state provided and used by this column

methods.name: copyWithNewValue
methods.comment: Create a new data object from this data, changing only the cells' value object

return.comment: A new data object with the same state as this object.

methods.name: setRowData
methods.comment: Set data specific to a row, as used during the rendering phase

params.name: rowObject
params.comment: Object for which this table row is generated

methods.name: setCellData
methods.comment: Set data specific to a cell, as used during the rendering phase

params.name: isSelected
params.comment:
True if the cell is to be rendered with the 
 selection highlighted; otherwise false.

params.name: hasFocus
params.comment: This cell has the users' focus.

name: GTableCellRenderingData
comment:
A state object to provide a table cell renderer with data beyond the standard Java 
 javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer interface.
 
 Additional data about the context of a rendering operation -- like the columns' Settings 
 or the row-object -- are easily passed to the renderer without refactor of each client.
